description: Find out how to become a taxi proprietor

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["The majority of the 20,000 taxi vehicles currently licensed are owned and driven by individual licensed drivers."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
However, a significant number are owned and maintained by individuals and companies. They rent them out to licensed taxi drivers who do not own a vehicle.
In order to become an approved London taxi proprietor you must meet be aged 21 or over.
When an individual or company applies to become a proprietor, we will take the following into consideration:

a. An applicant's criminal record via a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check
b. Any offences under taxi legislation
c. Any previous history as a proprietor
d. Whether the taxi itself is fit for purpose
As a proprietor you are responsible for:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Maintaining the mechanics and fabric of your taxis to the standard we require","Making the vehicles available for inspection byÂ our taxi and private hire officers","Maintaining records of drivers using your taxis in accordance with privacy and data protection legislation.","Returning expired licence plates to us"]}
There is no application fee to become a proprietor, other than the cost of completing a criminal records check.
1. Apply for a standard DBS check through our service provider GBGroup , unless you can confirm you are not required to submit one.
2. As soon as you have your DBS reference number to become a proprietor, please call us on 0343 222 4444 ( TfL call charges ) or email us to request an application.
3.	We will contact you once your application has been approved. You are then ready to apply to have your taxi(s) licensed.
